intro: Aeschynomene inyangensis, commonly known as the African leadplant, is a flowering plant native to tropical and southern Africa. It is a small, annual herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant has slender, branched stems and small, alternate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are pale blue or purple and are arranged in racemes, attracting various pollinators. Aeschynomene inyangensis is known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
